intro: Burlingtonia granadensis, commonly known as the Granada hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
